actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation

official_title: A bill to amend the Hazardous Materials Transportation Act to restrict the transportation of radioactive materials through high-density metropolitan areas.
short_title: Radioactive Materials Transportation Protection Act of 1985

summary.text: Radioactive Materials Transportation Protection Act of 1985 - Amends the Hazardous Materials Transportation Act to direct the Secretary of Transportation, when route determinations are made for the shipment of such material, to file an environmental impact statement which includes consideration of alternative modes of transporting a controlled quantity of radioactive materials into or through a high-density metropolitan area. Requires the Secretary to include the use of barges when considering such alternative modes of transportation. Applies the alternative transportation modes requirement to route determinations made after January 19, 1981.

titles.title: Radioactive Materials Transportation Protection Act of 1985
A bill to amend the Hazardous Materials Transportation Act to restrict the transportation of radioactive materials through high-density metropolitan areas.
